reused_details.reused: China Struggles With COVID, Infections After Loosening of , 'Zero-COVID' Restrictions.
reused_by_aic: BEIJING ' A rash of COVID-19 cases in schools and businesses were reported Friday in areas across China after the ruling Communist Party loosened anti-virus rules as it tries to reverse a deepening economic slump.
But they are a jarring change for China, where 'zero COVID,' which aims to isolate every case, disrupted daily life and depressed economic activity but kept infection rates low.
'Relaxing COVID controls will lead to greater outbreaks,' Neil Thomas and Laura Gloudeman of Eurasia Group said in a report.
